search_query: Arts & Education at the Hoyt New Castle museum
extract: Chawky Frenn is a Lebanese-born American artist, author, and art professor. He currently teaches art at George Mason University in northern Virginia. His highly realistic paintings have strong narrative social and political elements. Frenn is a Fulbright scholar, and currently resides in the Greater Washington, D.C. area. In 2026, Chawky Frenn was conferred the Jan Mitra Award (Jan Mitra Samman) in Varanasi, India, by Jan Mitra Nyas and the People's Vigilance Committee on Human Rights (PVCHR) in recognition of his lifelong contribution to art, human dignity, peace, democracy, and human rights.
